coverCard.text: The date of our wedding is Saturday 30th May 2020

cards.title: Ceremony
cards.text: The ceremony starts at 2.00pm. Please be seated at 1.45pm

cards.title: Reception
cards.text: After the ceremony, there will be a drinks reception and garden games in the Manor House next door (hopefully outside - fingers crossed!)

cards.title: Dinner
cards.text: Dinner will take place in Tithe Barn at 4.30pm. Speeches will take place immediately afterwards

cards.title: Evening
cards.text: After the speeches, the Tithe Barn will be setup for drinks and dancing

coverCard.text: We are getting married at Ufton Court, Ufton Nervet, Green Lane, Reading, RG7 4HD

cards.title: Trains
cards.text:
The nearest station is Theale.

There are direct trains from London Paddington

cards.title: Taxi
cards.text: Theale station does not have a taxi rank. The venue is in the middle of nowhere. Make sure you pre-book one for each leg of your journey - here is a list of some local suppliers

cards.title: Driving
cards.text: Google Maps does a great job at directing you to the venue. There is parking on site - but you need to remove your car by 9am next morning if you are leaving it overnight

cards.title: Accommodation
cards.text: There are a few options for places to stay. Donnington Valley is approximately a 30min drive away and the Hind's Head is 10 mins away. The Best Western and Holiday Inn are slightly cheaper alternatives, also 10 minutes away.

cards.title: Gifts
cards.text: We look forward to celebrating our day with you - no gifts please

cards.title: Phone signal
cards.text: Unfortunately phone signal is dodgy at best at the venue

cards.title: Weather
cards.text: The ceremony and dinner will all be inside. If it’s sunny - and we hope it is - you can feel to wander around during the reception drinks. Otherwise, we are pretty well set if the weather isn’t great

cards.title: Children
cards.text: Unforunately we are unable to accommodate children at our wedding

coverCard.text: You can email as at charlieandjack11@gmail.com
